Class RailType

    • com.bergerkiller.bukkit.tc.rails.type.RailType
  • Direct Known Subclasses:

extends java.lang.Object

    • Method Detail

      • handleCriticalError

        public static void handleCriticalError(RailType railType,
                                       java.lang.Throwable reason)
        Handles a critical error that occurred while using a certain RailType. If the RailType was externally registered by a plugin, it is unregistered to prevent further failing of TrainCarts itself.
        Parameters:
        railType - to unregister
        reason - for unregistering

      • unregister

        public static void unregister(RailType type)
        Unregisters a Rail Type so it can no longer be used
        Parameters:
        type - to unregister

      • register

        public static void register(RailType type,
                            boolean withPriority)
        Registers a Rail Type for use
        Parameters:
        type - to register
        withPriority - - True to make it activate prior to other types, False after

      • values

        public static java.util.Collection<RailType> values()
        Gets a Collection of all available Rail Types. The NONE constant is not included.
        Returns:
        Rail Types

      • getType

        public static RailType getType(org.bukkit.block.Block railsBlock)
        Tries to find the Rail Type a specific rails block represents. If none is identified, NONE is returned.
        Parameters:
        railsBlock - to get the RailType of
        Returns:
        the RailType, or NONE if not found

      • loadRailInformation

        public static boolean loadRailInformation(RailState state)
        Checks all registered rail types and attempts to load it into a RailState object. This provides information such as rails block and rail type used. Some performance enhancements are used to make this lookup faster for repeated calls for positions inside the same block. Note that the position does not have to be the same position as the rails block itself. For example, rails that have trains hover above or below it will have entirely different rails blocks.
        Parameters:
        state - to load with rail information
        Returns:
        True if rails were found (railtype != NONE), False otherwise

      • findRailInfo

        @Deprecated
public static RailInfo findRailInfo(org.bukkit.block.Block posBlock)
        Deprecated. 
        Deprecated: use findRailInfo(Location) instead
        Parameters:
        posBlock - block position where the Minecart is at
        Returns:
        rail info at this block, null if no rails are found

      • findRailInfo

        public static RailInfo findRailInfo(org.bukkit.Location position)
        Checks all registered rail types and attempts to find it for the Minecart position specified. Some performance enhancements are used to make this lookup faster for repeated calls for positions inside the same block. Note that the position does not have to be the same position as the rails block itself. For example, rails that have trains hover above or below it will have entirely different rails blocks.
        Parameters:
        position - in world coordinates where to look for rails
        Returns:
        rail info at this block, null if no rails are found

      • isRail

        public abstract boolean isRail(com.bergerkiller.bukkit.common.wrappers.BlockData blockData)
        Checks whether the block data given denote this type of Rail. This function is called from #isRail(world, x, y, z) exclusively. If the rails is more complex than one type of Block, override that method and ignore this one.
        Parameters:
        blockData - of the Block
        Returns:
        True if it is this type of Rail, False if not

      • isRail

        public boolean isRail(org.bukkit.World world,
                      int x,
                      int y,
                      int z)
        Checks whether the Block specified denote this type of Rail. To check for complex structures, this method should be overrided to check for that.
        Parameters:
        world - the Block is in
        x - - coordinate of the Block
        y - - coordinate of the Block
        z - - coordinate of the Block
        Returns:
        True if it is this Rail, False if not

      • isRail

        public final boolean isRail(org.bukkit.block.Block block,
                            org.bukkit.block.BlockFace offset)
        Checks whether the Block face specified denote this type of Rail
        Parameters:
        block - to check
        offset - face from the block to check
        Returns:
        True if it is this Rail, False if not

      • isRail

        public final boolean isRail(org.bukkit.block.Block block)
        Checks whether the Block specified denote this type of Rail
        Parameters:
        block - to check
        Returns:
        True if it is this Rail, False if not

      • getBoundingBox

        public RailAABB getBoundingBox(org.bukkit.block.Block railsBlock)
        Gets the bounding box of a rails block. This bounding box is used to calculate the face direction when a minecart enters the rails. It should surround the entire rails block for optimal results.
        Parameters:
        railsBlock -
        Returns:
        bounding box

      • isComplexRailBlock

        public final boolean isComplexRailBlock()
        Gets whether #isRail(World, x, y, z) is overrided, indicating this rail type is more complex than a single block
        Returns:
        True if this is a complex rail block

      • isUpsideDown

        public boolean isUpsideDown(org.bukkit.block.Block railsBlock)
        Gets whether blocks surrounding the rails block indicate the rails is used upside-down. It is only upside-down when the block 'below' the rails is air, and a solid block exists above. This strict rule avoids regular tracks turning into upside-down tracks. Rail types that don't support upside-down Minecarts should always return false here.
        Parameters:
        railsBlock -
        Returns:
        True if the rails are upside-down

      • findRail

        @Deprecated
public org.bukkit.block.Block findRail(org.bukkit.block.Block pos)
        Deprecated. 
        Deprecated: use findRails(Block) instead.
        Parameters:
        pos - Block a Minecart is 'at'
        Returns:
        the rail of this type, or null if not found

      • findRails

        public java.util.List<org.bukkit.block.Block> findRails(org.bukkit.block.Block positionBlock)
        Tries to find all the Rails blocks of this Rail Type for a Minecart whose position is inside a particular Block. Multiple different rails can have logic for a single block area. If no rails are found, it is recommended to return Collections.emptyList().
        Parameters:
        positionBlock - to find rails at
        Returns:
        railsBlocks list of rails blocks of this rail type (do NOT return null!)

      • findMinecartPos

        @Deprecated
public abstract org.bukkit.block.Block findMinecartPos(org.bukkit.block.Block trackBlock)
        Deprecated. 
        Deprecated: this is no longer being used
        Parameters:
        trackBlock - where this Rail Type is at
        Returns:
        Minecart position

      • getPossibleDirections

        @Deprecated
public abstract org.bukkit.block.BlockFace[] getPossibleDirections(org.bukkit.block.Block trackBlock)
        Deprecated. 
        Gets an array containing all possible directions a Minecart can move on the trackBlock.
        Deprecated: implement #getJunctions() instead (if needed)
        Parameters:
        trackBlock - to use
        Returns:
        all possible directions the Minecart can move

      • getJunctions

        public java.util.List<RailJunction> getJunctions(org.bukkit.block.Block railBlock)
        Gets an array containing all possible junctions that can be taken for a particular rail block. There does not have to be a valid rail at the end for a junction to exist. By default the two end points of the path returned by the logic for a 'down' direction are returned.
        Parameters:
        railBlock - where this Rail Type is at
        Returns:
        list of junctions supported by this rail type, empty if no junctions are available

      • takeJunction

        public RailState takeJunction(org.bukkit.block.Block railBlock,
                              RailJunction junction)
        Prepares a RailState when taking a junction returned by getJunctions(Block). Feeding this state into a walking point will enable further discovery past the junction.
        Parameters:
        railBlock - where this Rail Type is at
        junction - to check
        Returns:
        RailState after taking the junction, null if there is no rails here

      • switchJunction

        public void switchJunction(org.bukkit.block.Block railBlock,
                           RailJunction from,
                           RailJunction to)
        Switches the rails from one junction to another. Junctions are used from #getJunctions(railBlock).
        Parameters:
        railBlock - where this Rail Type is at
        from - junction
        to - junction

      • getDirection

        Obtains the direction of this type of Rails. This is the direction along minecarts move.
        Parameters:
        railsBlock - to get it for
        Returns:
        rails Direction

      • getLogic

        @Deprecated
public RailLogic getLogic(MinecartMember<?> member,
                                       org.bukkit.block.Block railsBlock,
                                       org.bukkit.block.BlockFace direction)
        Deprecated. 
        Obtains the Rail Logic to use for the Minecart at the (previously calculated) rail position in a World.
        Deprecated: use #getLogic(RailLogicState) instead.
        Parameters:
        member - to get the logic for (can be null when used by track walkers for e.g. spawning)
        railsBlock - the Minecart is driving on
        direction - in which the Minecart is moving. Only block directions (north/east/south/west/up/down) are used.
        Returns:
        Rail Logic

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        desired rail logic

      • onBlockPhysics

        Parameters:

      • isRailsSupported

        public boolean isRailsSupported(org.bukkit.block.Block railsBlock)
        Gets whether this Rails Type is supported by a block it is attached to. If this returns False, the rails block is automatically broken and an item is dropped.
        Parameters:
        railsBlock - to check
        Returns:
        True if the rails block is supported

      • onPreMove

        public void onPreMove(MinecartMember<?> member)
        Called right before a Minecart is moved from one point to the other. This is called after the pre-movement updates performed by rail logic.
        Parameters:
        member - that is about to be moved

      • onPostMove

        public void onPostMove(MinecartMember<?> member)
        Called right after a Minecart was moved from one point to the other. This is called after the post-movement updates performed by rail logic.
        Parameters:
        member - that just moved

      • onCollide

        public boolean onCollide(MinecartMember<?> with,
                         org.bukkit.block.Block block,
                         org.bukkit.block.BlockFace hitFace)
        Handles collision with this Rail Type
        Parameters:
        with - Minecart that his this Rail
        block - of this Rail
        hitFace - of this Rail
        Returns:
        True if collision is allowed, False if not

      • onBlockCollision

        public boolean onBlockCollision(MinecartMember<?> member,
                                org.bukkit.block.Block railsBlock,
                                org.bukkit.block.Block hitBlock,
                                org.bukkit.block.BlockFace hitFace)
        Handles a Minecart colliding with a Block while using this Rail Type.
        Parameters:
        member - that collided
        railsBlock - the member is driving on
        hitBlock - the Minecart hit
        hitFace - the Minecart hit
        Returns:
        True if collision is allowed, False if not

      • isHeadOnCollision

        public boolean isHeadOnCollision(MinecartMember<?> member,
                                 org.bukkit.block.Block railsBlock,
                                 org.bukkit.block.Block hitBlock)
        Gets whether a minecart hit a block 'head-on', meaning it should stop the train
        Parameters:
        member - that hit a block
        railsBlock - the minecart is on
        hitBlock - that was hit
        Returns:
        True if head-on, False if not

      • getSpawnLocation

        public org.bukkit.Location getSpawnLocation(org.bukkit.block.Block railsBlock,
                                            org.bukkit.block.BlockFace orientation)
        Gets the initial location of a minecart when placed on this Rail Type. By default spawns the Minecart on top of the block, facing the orientation
        Parameters:
        railsBlock - to spawn on
        orientation - horizontal orientation of the one that placed the minecart
        Returns:
        spawn location

      • getRailsTexture

        public RailsTexture getRailsTexture(org.bukkit.block.Block railsBlock)
        Gets rails texture information about this Rail Type for a particular Block. This texture is displayed in the editor.
        Parameters:
        railsBlock -
        Returns:
        rails texture
